intro: Afrosolen setifolius, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are typically narrow and pointed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Afrosolen setifolius is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its natural habitat.
